DOCUMENT 14
ELECTRONICALLY FILED
6/24/2024 12:42 PM
70-DR-2023-900051.01
CIRCUIT COURT OF
TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
PATRICK CRADDOCK, CLERK
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND,
Plaintiff,
v. CASE NO.: 70-DR-23-900051.01
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE
MCGREGOR,
Defendant.
ANSWER TO COUNTER-PETITION
COMES NOW, Petitioner BRITTANY GILLILAND, by and through the undersigned
counsel of record, Barbara H. Agricola and Matthew A. Holdren,1 with the law firm of Agricola
Law, LLC, and files this Answer to Respondent’s Counterclaim [Doc. 7]. As grounds therefore,
Petitioner answers as follows:
1. Petitioner ADMITS the allegations and averments contained in paragraphs 1, 2, 3, 4,
5, and 6 of Respondent’s Counter-Petition;
2. Petitioner DENIES the allegations and averments contained in paragraphs 7 and 8 of
the Respondent’s Counter-Petition and demands strict proof thereof;
3. Petitioner DENIES that Respondent is entitled to the requested relief sought and
demands strict proof thereof.
Respectfully submitted on June 24, 2024.
/s/ Barbara H. Agricola (AGR004)
/s/ Matthew A. Holdren
OF COUNSEL: Counsel for Petitioner
AGRICOLA LAW
1 Matthew A. Holdren is a third-year law student at Faulkner University’s Jones School of Law, and has received his
3L practice card from the Alabama State Bar. Mr. Holdren has fulfilled all requirements pursuant to Alabama State
Bar’s Rule for Legal Internship by Law Students, and Petitioner, BRITTANY GILLILAND, has consented to Mr.
Holdren appearing on her behalf under the supervision of the attorneys of Agricola Law, LLC.
Brittany Michelle Gilliland v. Christopher Blaine McGregor
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County
Case No.: 70-DR-23-900051.01
